page.title: 17Education in Ayr, 1985.
page.content: To meet the obligation to provide {education}suitable for the age, aptitude and ability of every child the authority has, in the town of Ayr, 24 schools and a college of{Further {Education.2 Nursery Schools and 1 {Nursery Class}offer 360 pupil places. {3 Special Schools}offer places for pupils who may be mildly, or severely or profoundly mentally handicapped. Of the{14 Primary Schools}2 are for R.C. pupils. Most of the schools are modern,4 being of semi_open plan design, but 4 date from the late 19th century. They offer 5700 pupil places for a present roll of 4330.The 5 {Secondary Schools}are fully compre_ hensive 6 year schools. They offer 6500 places for a roll of 4600 pupils. Ayr{F.E. College}specialises in building, catering and business studies.
